name: DiMe core
body:
# Digital Me

The task of the Digital Me (DiMe) server is to collect your personal data from various loggers into a central place _that you control_. You can run DiMe in your local machine or in a server. The DiMe server source code is open source software licensed under
[the MIT License][MIT].

You can start collecting your personal data in two easy steps:

1. Install the DiMe core server on your own machine. [See the README on github][README] for instructions.
2. Install one or more loggers which collect different aspects of your life and log them to your own DiMe server.


[README]: https://github.com/HIIT/dime-server#readme
[MIT]: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
